climbs.name: Zu den händen von Herrn Wiesenthal

content.description:
Move to C1 near the lefty, black corner. Climb straight up on great holds to C2.

Follow the hour glassy crack with tricky jams and feet to the short vertical face to the anchors.
content.protection:
5 clips to Mussy hooks provided by

https://www.safeclimbing.org

.
content.location:
Locate

Shelfie

, and walk about 30 seconds past it.

content.description: Climb an easy reachy start to a smallish break. Climb the black, vertical face to the big bulge. Pull the bulge on the left with great in-cuts, killer pocket, not-so-good feet, and reachy edges to a flat ledge. Move past 2 clips to the anchors.
content.location:
Start just right of

Portable Airplane

(aka Robbin' the Hood).

content.description:
Climb the short crack past C1 to a stance. Gain the big pocketed face past C2 through C5.

Continue on steepening rock on good reachy holds to C6. There is bulgy rock on good but reachy and hard to locate holds past C7. An exciting finish to the reachy anchors awaits you.
content.location:
Start just right of

Creepy Ass Cracker

.

content.description: Ascend juggy climbing for two clips, and then climb the tricky face for three clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
It is in between

Zu den händen von Herrn Wiesenthal

and

Anselmo Power

.

content.description:
It is hard to believe a route of this vintage and quality has eluded the database until now. Expect old-school on this route: hardware, bolt-spacing, and grade, although 11d seems right on. This is almost as good as

Lats

.

Employ right heel-hooking and/or high-stepping to gain the crucial second bolt. Once clipped, the potential for a big fall exists, but you will not hit the ground. Reload the guns at the huge, right-facing flake about mid-pitch. Traverse right and then up, sequentially, on sharp pockets to a big hole followed by a bigger jug. Take a deep breath, and clip a bolt. Cruise to the anchor.
content.location:
Walking west along the trail toward the far right margin of the Far Side Wall, look for a partially hidden and slightly overhanging wall. Take a faint trail uphill toward this wall, then down into a hole where begins the route, and its neighbor to the right, Like a Horse.

If you reach the leaning block of

Abracadabra

, you've gone too far.

content.description: Begin with a fairly easy start to C1. Climb the corner with a few tricky .8 moves to a rest. Continue straight up the corner with huge wedged blocks near C7 to the anchors.
content.location:
From

Lizard Ledge

, start just left of

Flying High Again

.

content.description: Velociraptor ascends big pockets with pretty good footholds to C1, then you get vertical climbing straight up on more big pockets & sidepulls to and past C5. Finish on big pockets & edges past 2 clips to the reachy anchors.
content.protection:
7 clips to chained anchors.

*The top section is runout to the anchors.*
content.location:
At

The Lizard Ledge

, it is about 20 feet left of

Gila

.

content.description: This ascends a very short, medium width crack.
content.protection: Gear to 4" (wider gear somewhat optional) and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is located on the short wall just past

Eh, Nice Route

.

content.description: Layback a hand-sized crack.
content.protection: Gear to 2" and a bolted anchor.
content.location:
This is located about 100' down the trail from

Eh, Nice Route.

content.description: This ascends a medium width crack.
content.protection: Gear to 4" (wider gear somewhat optional) and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is about 50 feet to the right of

Eh, Nice Route

.

content.description: Start on top of the block to clip C1. Follow the weakness with nice hands and feet with steepening rock for 4 clips to the anchors.
content.location:
Start several feet left of

Portable Airplane (aka Robbin' the Hood)

content.description: Begin with a cruxy start on black rock to an easier section. Then follow the smallish groove to the anchors. The route is still dirty in spots but pretty fun and possibly the easiest route at the Far Side.
content.protection: 9 bolts to anchors with chains on them.
content.location: If coming from the backside parking lot, follow the Far Side trail up to the main Far Side wall. This is the fourth route past the Lizard Ledge right before several descending steps.

content.description: Gain the big scary, hollow sounding flake to the first bolt. Move right through 3 clips with cruxy climbing near the arete. Climb up a few more clips to the anchors.
content.protection: 7 bolts to 2 anchors with chains on them.
content.location: This is located just to the right of The Exorcist.

content.description:
This has tricky start moves up a right-leaning arch. Keep moving right to crack then up the face to "

3 Holes

" finish over a bulge.
content.location: This starts from the middle of Lizard Ledge.

content.description: A crux start leads to some cool reaches to pockets through the finish.
content.location:
Start right of the obvious, right-leaning ramp of

Three Holes Make a Face

(5.10d). Cross this route and continue straight up to the anchor.

content.description:
Thin holds for 4 bolts place you at the last one, a single cold shut to lower from.

A stick clip is recommended. Somewhat insecure climbing gets you to the first bolt, at which point you're nicely above the starting ledge.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Lower off of the single top coldshut.
content.location:
30 feet to the right of

Ahkenaten

, start on a ledge ~15 feet up with a tree growing on the ledge in front of the start of the climb.

content.description: So Emotional has great easier climbing on nice stone the whole way. Use the lefty arete and smooth holds on the right.
content.location:
At

RAMM Corridor,

start left of

Party Hardy Tardy Marty

.

content.description:
It is easy climbing to C1. Climb the small hollow flake with big holds to a nice small ledge near C3. Follow the right fingery crack and some great sinker pockets on the left blond face to C5.

Move left with a sweet undercling with close pockets and thinker feet to a really reachy C6. Good hidden holds out reachy left near C6 move you up to C7. Big holds up and left with more thinker feet and sustained 10ish pulling lets you clip the chained anchors.
content.location:
Start about 30+ feet right and around the corner from

Portable Airplane

.

content.description:
Climb the same start as

Zu den händen von Herrn Wiesenthal

, but move left to the long, black, slabby face for 6 clips passing great hand holds and feet to a smallish break under C7.

Pull the upper face on the left with big, reachy, flat jugs and tricky feet for 2 clips to the anchors.
content.protection:
8 clips to Mussy hooks provided by

https://www.safeclimbing.org

.
content.location:
Use the same start as

Zu den händen von Herrn Wiesenthal

.

content.description: This has vertical climbing on the reddish face, then climb a big holds mid-section to C3. Finish with a face to a bulge to the anchors.
content.location:
It is the first route left of

Mental Hopscotch

.

content.description:
Get big righty holds to C1. Once past C1, move right and clip C2 with a stance out right.

Move to the arête on good / slopey / fingery holds and feet past 3 clips to the anchors.
content.location:
Start just up the trail from

Anselmo Power

or just below

666

.

content.description:
Climb some dusty rock to C1. Clip C1 and move up and left into the obvious flake system.

Fun well-protected climbing follows the flake system on big holds, some tricky feet, and a brief crux at C6 past C7 to the anchors.
content.protection:
7 clips to Mussy hooks provided by

https://www.safeclimbing.org

.
content.location:
Start just right of

666

.

content.description: Start with great, vertical black rock with cruxy moves past 2 clips to a small break. Climb the black, slabby face to the chained anchors.
content.location:
This is the second route past the Lizard Ledge when coming up the trail from the parking area. Or it is just left of

First Class Tickets to The Resurrection

.

content.description:
"Climb a broken crack system to anchors beneath a bulge.  A decent, albeit short, route."

-from Fred Knapp's 'Shelf Road Rock'.
content.location: This is about halfway down the Far Side (as you walk Westward).  This is probably the shortest route you'll find, as well as one of the easiest at the Far Side.

content.description:
Gain the arete with stemming to C1. Follow the arete with increasing vertical difficulty past 4 clips to the chained anchors.

This route is possibly harder for shorter climbers. This route never gets sun.
content.location:
At

RAMM Corridor

, hop a boulder just up and right of

One Ton Son

to start.

content.description:
Follow the arete on great black rock with big edges and pockets with a thinker exit to the anchors.

Watch your back when lowering. This route never gets sun.
content.location:
At

RAMM Corridor

. this is the first route left of

Abracadabra

or right behind

One Ton Son

.

content.description:
This route never gets sun.

Start with vertical climbing for 3 clips, and then stem and pull straight up to the chained anchors.

Watch your back when lowering

.
content.location:
At

RAMM Corridor

, start in the narrow corridor up and right of

Wun Dum Fuk

.

content.description: This climb goes up the cleaner center section of the panel between the easier climbs that follow the crack/ramp systems.
content.location:
About 2/3rds of the way up the Far Side cliff, this is the center/clean panel climb in the last set of climbs before a break in the cliff. After the break is the

Induction Oven

/

Hume's Horror

set of climbs.

content.description: Climb nice hands and feet to C1. Then you get vertical to overhanging climbing on buckets to C4. Continue on not-so-good hands but good feet past C6 to the awkward to clip anchors.
content.location:
Start on the reddish prow about 20 feet right of

Hume's Horror

.

content.description: Mary Iguana ascends sharp, vertical holds with small footholds to a tricky, sidepull crux near the fourth clip.
content.location:
At

The Lizard Ledg

e

, it it in between

5.6 Crack

&

Lizard of Oz

.

content.description: Mardi Gras has nice pocket pulling to a small overlap, then it goes out the bulge to the anchors. This passes two large pockets en route.
content.location:
This is just right of the

Centurion

corner.

content.description: Start with big holds to C1. Move up on good fingery holds to C2. Cruise straight up on steepening rock and two mini-cracks to the anchors.
content.location:
It is the first route at the Lizard Ledge or just right of

Lizard of Oz

.

content.description: This climb goes up the center of a clean panel then up through several overlaps and bulges.
content.location:
It ascends the center of the clean panel just left of the large, obvious flake,

Flakeus Maximus

.

content.description:
Black is beautiful.  Climb the dark, vertical to overhanging wall past 10 or so clips.  The difficulties come quickly (at the 2nd bolt), but the pitch is engaging all the way to the anchors.

Note: you can cheat the crux on the right with some offwidth debauchery... drops the grade to .10d or so.  Still a stellar line.
content.protection: ~10 quickdraws and something for the anchors.
content.location:
This route is a little removed by Shelf standards. From the old Gallery parking area, follow the well worn trail toward the Far Side.  After you reach the cliffs, continue north for a few minutes until it's possible to scramble up onto a comfortable ledge about twenty feet up off the trail. At the southernmost end of this terrace, you'll find a stunning black panel and one of Shelf's best kept secrets. Enjoy.

Per

Stevenstrangeways Hurd

: this is the first route on Lizard Ledge.

content.description: Start in the smooth corner to C1. Continue in the corner with pretty good hand holds and good feet through C2 to C3. Move left at the wedged chockstone to C4 and then on to the anchors.
content.location:
From

Lizard Ledge

, start in the corner 20 feet right of

5.6 Crack

.

content.description: Start on 5.6 crack, and move left to the first clip of TLK. Continue left with thin feet and some lefty reaches to C2. Grab the good / hollow flake, and move up past it with some sustained low 10ish climbing for 3 clips under the smallish bulge. Pull the bulge with one clip. Climb up and left past C7 to the chained anchors.
content.location:
From

Lizard Ledge

, do the same start as

5.6 Crack

.

content.description:
This ascends a finger crack with a good layback just to the left of the

Unknown 5.8

.
content.protection:
Gear to 1" and a shared anchor with the

Unknown 5.7

.
content.location:
It is just to the right of the

Unknown 5.7

.

content.description:
Where logical fallacies are cooked up?  This is the sister route to

Hume's Horror

.  Although not as sustained, expect a few harder moves.
content.protection: 6 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
8 feet to the left of

Hume's Horror

, directly across the canyon from the west side of Menses Prow.

climbs.name: In the Region of the Butterfly Pump

content.description:
To find this route, please see the directions for "Abracadabra".  ITROTBP is the route just to the right of Abracadabra, and faces north-ish.

This is a pretty darn good route.  The climbing is fairly continuous, and there isn't really any showstopper cruxes.  This is definitely another route where good footwork and technique will probably go further than strength.  Try your best to avoid stemming back against the Abracadabra pillar :)

"This climbs the dark black streak left of Black is Beautiful.  Traverse to the first bolt from the left.  One red hanger at the start."

-From Fred Knapp's Shelf Road Rock.

The crux for me was between bolts 2 and 3.  There was some non-trivial sequencing to work out, to say the least!
content.location: The first five routes at Far Side begin atop a large terrace above the trail and can be accessed most easily from the West side (after the 5th route, Thick As Thieves, 5.12a).  Iguana Breath is the first route on the smooth North-facing rock atop this terrace.

content.description: The description from Thompson guidebook, 2017... "this superb route starts in the Dragon's Lair behind a tree, a short distance right of the corner. Follow the line of bolts up a beautifully clean wall to anchors."
content.protection:
7 bolts with a bed frame hanger for #1 and newer hangers for the rest of the route. Don't be put off by the spacing. This is easy off the deck, but ya know, safety third.

Heads up: the anchors at the top have a bad setup. A rap is advised.
content.location:
It is at The Gallery, towards the end of Far Side in a cool setting. Go past the Well Hung amphitheater, up the scramble past

Blackshirts

, then go down into the pit. The left side wall is

Chomping at the Bit

, the left dihedral crack is

Coffee Bitch

- this is the line directly in front of the tree.

content.description: Follow gently overhanging jugs up to the final roof crux.  Pull up and right over the roof to good clipping holds above the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: After reaching the Far Side cliff proper, walk 5 minutes along the base past Sympathy For the Devil and before Well Hung.  Hume's Horror sits in an alcove formed by two slightly overhanging, pocketed, red and yellow walls.  With your back to the route, you would be staring directly at the west face of Menses Prow.

content.description: Climb up a face with an arete to the right. Start with your right hand on the arete and your left on small edges. Slap up the arete till you get a good hold to clip the first bolt. Slap up with the right a couple more times while utilizing mono pockets for your left till you can clip the second bolt. The next four bolts are easier but keep you on your game. Climb over one more bolt, moving right to the anchor. Stick clip the first bolt or have a good spot if you don't like climbing 5.10 unprotected to the first bolt. This is dedicated to anyone who has unfortunately been touched by the scourge of cancer.
content.protection: Seven bolts to an anchor with lowering quicklinks.
content.location:
This is 10' right of

Shelfie

and shares an anchor with an unknown trad crack, directly left of "Exorcist" (11c).

content.description: Follow the arete with good holds to cruxes near the 4th & 5th clips. Continue straight up on big pocket pulling to the chained anchors.
content.protection: 9 clips to chained anchors. Rap the route.
content.location:
At

The Lizard Ledge

, this uses the same start as

Lizard With a View

but busts left.

content.description: Climb the low, techy face past 3 clips to a large ledge. Go straight up the vertical face to a final bulgy section to the anchors.
content.protection:
13 bolts? to the anchors.

Use caution getting from C3 to C4.
content.location:
Start just left and downhill from

A.W.E.S.O.M.- O 4000

.

content.description: Climb on big holds to C1. Continue with tough fingery moves with thin feet over the small bulge to a small rest. Find more tough moves for a few more clips on the smooth slab to a break. Climb vertical rock past 3 clips to the anchors. It is possibly harder than .12-?
content.location:
Start from

Lizard Ledge.

content.description:
Climb the great BIG, left-trending flake with some sustained smooth jams, hidden holds inside the flake, pretty good feet and pockets and small edges on the left face for 5 clips to a small break at C6.

Gain the small break and climb the upper face on thinker pockets and tricky feet past C7 and then big pockets to and past C8 to the chained anchors.
content.location: Start on the big flake right of Lord of the Warlocks.

climbs.name: First Class Tickets to The Resurrection

content.description: The first half of the route is fairly easy on nice black rock. Then climb straight up the blonde face with some cruxy moves to the anchors.
content.protection: 11 bolts to anchors with chains on them.
content.location:
Start just left of

Too Many Notes, Your Majesty

.

content.description:
There are two starts to this route: begin climbing the overhanging fist crack on tan rock or begin a little to the right on a prominent black bulge in the rock.

Once you are up by the 2 parallel hand cracks, you'll begin to veer up and to the right. The crack tapers more and more the higher you go until the very top where you can grab an excellent knife edge that will lead you the last several feet to the anchors.

Attention: there are no rings on the anchors yet, just hangers. I rapped off the hangers without damaging my rope, but that may not be a risk you want to take.
content.protection:
A standard rack up to #4 if you do the overhanging start.

A standard rack up to #2 if you do the soft start to the right.
content.location:
This is between

El Lagarto

and

Wedgie

on a face to the left of a larger corner. It is the 5th route from the left on the ledge.

content.description: Begin with a liebacky flake start past 2 clips to a small break. Move left for the bigger holds to and past C3. Gain the face with pockets, edges, not-so-good feet, and some sharp rock to C5. Continue with reachy big edges with pretty good feet and then big pockets to the anchors. This is tightly bolted climbing up the vertical face.
content.location:
This is the first route right of

Too Many Notes, Your Majesty

on the face of the detached pillar facing the trail.

content.description: Climb up a face just right of a large hollow flake. Move up to cold shuts on thin hands and feet, get under a bulge with dicey feet, and push through to the anchor.
content.location:
It is in between

Hair Today, Gone Tomorrow

and

To the Max Von Sydow

.

content.description:
To find this route, please see the direction for "

[105752980

]".  EIE is two routes to the right.  It begins by stepping off of a large belay slab and across a little gap to the first holds.

When I climb a route like this, it makes me so sad.  If this route was 195 feet of the material the first 3 bolts are made of it, it would be stellar.

But in the real world, it [isn't] always that way.  Enjoy the fun beginning (you have to look around a bit for the holds) and cruise up the last section.
content.protection:
4 bolts.  Last time I did it (few months ago), you could lower off the last bolt.  Or you can top out, hike west 200 yards and scramble down.

Per

Kenan

: Note that this route has a standard 2-bolt anchor now.

content.description: After starting up the crack, make a crux move right to a second clip. It is loose up top on the right edge of arête.
content.location: It is the [4th] route from the left on Lizard Ledge.

content.description: A short route emerged from the blight of obscurity. This is a quick hit for the anxious or just get one more in at the end of the day. Do not taunt the large, bulgy flake to the left as you pass the 2nd bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts + 2 point anchor with rap rings.
content.location: When the trail hits the wall, go up and left towards the route deemed "Unknown" in the Bob D'Antonio guide. Keep going left around a corner with a low roof and there you are.

content.description: Move right then up towards a reachy lefty C1. Move straight up on big incuts to C2. Climb straight up on smooth rock past 3 clips with vertical moves and a cruxy move to a stance. Climb a few final moves to the anchors.
content.location:
Start just right and slightly uphill from

Mental Hopscotch

.

content.description: Climb the small pillar past three bolts to the vertical face and on to the anchors.
content.location:
Start just right of

Eh, Nice Route

.

content.description: Start in the once dirty, low right corner on the right side of the pillar where it meets the wall. Move up and left through the face to attain the arete, then prepare to get needled.
content.protection: 5 bolts + a 2 point anchor with steel rap rings.
content.location: Walking the main trail towards the maze at the end of the Far Side, you will pass an obvious, large, detached pillar to the left of Mardi Gras and Lord of the Warlocks. Contemplate taking this route home with you.

content.description:
Start with tricky climbing with pretty good feet to C1. Move to C2 with better holds and a stance. Clip C3 and a close C4 with some harder moves to the start of the upper cruxy crack.

Jam the continous crack with some thinker feet, 2 big righty holds, and sharp rock past 4 clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
Start just right of

The Crush of Love

.

content.description:
Begin with big holds on nice ledges to C1. Move up on great lefty pockets and edges past some dusty rock to C2.

Move up and right with underclings and pockets with some hollow rock on the right to C3. Gain C4 on crimpers to a sweet, big, flat hold section.

Follow the deep hands crack with tricky feet to the chained anchors.
content.location:
Start just left of

The Cry of Love

.

content.description: Start in the zig-zaggy crack for 3 clips to a stance. Follow the arete for 4 clips to a hollow flake section below C8. Gain the flake, clip C8, and climb the steeper upper face past C9 on big holds to the chained anchors.
content.protection:
9 clips to Mussy hooks provided by

https://www.safeclimbing.org

.
content.location:
Locate the small alcove just above and right of Like a Horse or find Crow's Nest about 30 feet left of

Creepy Ass Cracker

.

content.description: Start in the wide crack with moderate climbing on good holds on the left and right sides of the deep crack for three clips to a stance out right. Clip C4, and climb straight up the steepening pocketed face for four clips with a finishing crux to the chains.
content.location:
Locate the small alcove just above and right of Like a Horse. Find Creepy Ass Cracker about 30 feet right of

Crow's Nest

.

content.description:
To find this route, please use the directions in "

Abracadabra

".  From

Abracadabra

, walk west about 20 feet and up onto a big tilted belay slab.  From here, you can peer down into a pit, from which a nice bolted chimney ascends on the left side.  This route is basically to the right of "

Chomping at the Bit

(13b).

If I were to name this route, I would probably call it "The Fischer Price My First Chimney Route".  This makes a pretty decent first chimney due to the fact that, should you tire of chimney-suffering, there are great face holds and you can pretty much stem the heck out of it.  However, if you want to get ready for pretty much any classic long route....
content.protection: Approximately 6 or 7 bolts and anchors.  If you want to drag your dusty old Big Bros out of the closet, go ahead.

content.description:
This route is located in the "Far Side" area, directly across from the Bulge Wall of Menses Prow.  It is a bit out of the way for Shelf...nice and secluded.  The route starts in a pit that stays nice and cool.  The climbing is very straightforward and easy (5.10ish) until you reach a brutal crux boulder problem at a distinct bulge.  Some tenuous moves on almost non-existant holds get you over the bulge, then the climbing eases to the chains.

This route is probably easier when it's cold.  The crux relies a lot on skin friction on some sharp holds, so the warmer the weather, the softer your skin will be.

I thought the moves were easy off the hang, but linking them proved harder than I first expected due to increasingly sore fingertips with each attempt.  This was rated 13b in Van Horn's books, the new Sharp End book calls it 13a, which I think is about right.

Climb the clean, left-facing crack on very positive holds. The crux is past the 4th bolt where the route goes vertical. A finger crack and a high-step pocket will get you to the anchors out to your right.
content.protection: 8 QDs and an anchor get the job done.
content.location:
This is to the right of the distinct

Detachable Pillar Arete

and left of

Flakeus Maximus

.

content.description:
Lieback and jam the flake system on great holds for 4 clips. Continue to follow the steepening, right-trending flake system with some sweet sinker pockets on the face and good feet at C5 to C6.

Climb great sidepulls and lefty pockets for 2 clips to a stance out left. Finish with techy face climbing for two clips to the chained anchors.
content.location:
Start just right of

In the Region of the Butterfly Pump

.

content.description: Short and bouldery crux at mid-height.
content.location: This route begins at the left side of the obvious right-leaning ramp of Three Holes Make a Face (5.10d).

content.description: Climb up and trend left to about half height at a big pocket and good stance.  2 more bolts of thin holds gets  you to the anchors, just below the ledge/break about 2/3 of the way up the cliff face.
content.location:
This is the 2nd route from the left on Lizard Ledge, left of the crack at the base separating this climb from

Arthur's Lip Service

on the right.

content.description: Start with tough climbing with righty, thin face holds, techy feet, and smooth lefty sidepulls for two clips to a BIG stance. Move straight up the face with good hands, thinker feet, and a few reaches for four clips to a small break. Climb superb rock split by a thin crack for three clips with pretty good crimpers, thin fingers in the crack, tough feet, and a few long reaches to the chains.
content.location:
It is in between

Big Lizard In My Backyard

and

El Largarto

.

content.description: Climb big holds to C1 then smaller and smaller holds up to C5 on great, Shelf smooth rock. Gain the smallish ledge, and continue up past 2 clips on vertical easier climbing to the anchors.
content.location:
It is in between

Flakeus Maximus

and

Tunnel Vision

.

content.description:
Climb good holds to C1. Climb straight up vertical rock with thinker feet, pretty good hand holds with nice edges/incuts, and pockets past two clips.

Continue up or move right to the arête past two clips to the anchors.
content.protection:
5 clips to Mussy hooks provided by

https://www.safeclimbing.org

.
content.location:
Start just right of

Zu den händen von Herrn Wiesenthal

.

content.description:
To find this route, hike west along the base of the wall on the "far side" until you are fairly close to the incredible hulk boulder.  At this point, the far side wall will have a few detached and semi-detached pillars that make it a bit maze like.  Hike west and slightly left, around a corner and there will be a nice recessed area with very dark rock.  In this recess is sort of a pillar sandwiched between two walls.  This is Abradacadbra and at the base of this route there is plenty of room to set up shop.

Abracadabra is one of the best 9s at Shelf (IMHO).  It isn't as long as Lumina (on the dark side), but the rock quality is comparable (very good).

If you can get through the first 2 bolts you are in like flynn.  The top section is a little bit runout, but the climbing is several grades easier at this point.  This route makes a good warm-up in the summer time as it is in the shade most of the day.  Enjoy.

From the ledge, climb good holds and feet to C1. Clip C1 and move right to a stance.

Follow the flake moving up then left with great righty holds, lefty face holds, and thinker feet for 4 clips to a break. Pass wooden Ahkenaten for 3 clips on big holds to the anchors.
content.location:
Start on the short ledge about 10 feet right of

RAMMESES

.

content.description:
Climb the 10 foot finger crack to a dusty ledge. Go straight up following the  crack / flake system to the chained anchors.

This is a new route, wear a helmet.
content.location: Hike the Far Side trail, and pass The Zoo. Where the trail meets the wall, A.W.E.S.O.M.-O 4000 is the first route on the left.

content.description:
Start a few feet left of

Ragged Ass Tinkering Cow Thieves

. Move up and left for a few clips to a break. Climb straight up the nice face with sustained moves to a cruxy finish to the anchors.
content.protection: 8 clips to anchors with chains on them.
content.location: This is the first route to the right of the Lizard Ledge.

content.description: Carrie yourself several feet above the trail to start. Climb the Karloff corner with creepy jams, tingly fingers, and some weary feet for three clips to the Lugosi ledge. A few devilish moves with a big reach to C5 gets you to C6. Levitate your way up past C7 to the Lon Chaney's.
content.location:
It is the first route right of

SETI

.

content.description: This is a fun, short climb.
content.location:
[Previously, this was] the farthest right route on Lizard Ledge.

Going from right to left, 5.6 Crack is the 3rd route on Lizard Ledge as of 10/1/17.
